summary: This is an email exchange between FBI personnel and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding a draft letter to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case concerning anticipated testimony. It shows coordination between law enforcement and prosecutors.

persons.name: Pomerantz
persons.context: Author of the email attaching a draft letter intended for defense counsel in the Maxwell case regarding anticipated testimony.

persons.name: FBI NY CART Coordinator Senior Examiner
persons.context: Recipient of the email from Pomerantz, asked to review the draft letter and call before 2 PM.

connections.person2: FBI NY CART Coordinator Senior Examiner
connections.description: Prosecutor (Pomerantz) is coordinating with FBI examiner regarding a draft letter for defense counsel in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Draft Letter Coordination
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Pomerantz sends a draft letter regarding anticipated testimony to an FBI examiner for review before sending it to defense counsel in the Maxwell case.
personsInvolved: FBI NY CART Coordinator Senior Examiner

keyFacts: The document is an email exchange dated November 26, 2021, regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Assistant U.S. Attorney Pomerantz is preparing to send a draft letter to Maxwell's defense counsel concerning anticipated testimony.
The FBI NY CART Coordinator Senior Examiner is asked to review the draft letter and coordinate via phone call.
The communication shows ongoing legal and investigative coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI in the Maxwell prosecution.
